Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the deficit in the Republican-led 2012-13 budget by stating it as a $40 million deficit.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it only provides the figures of the surplus in the 2010-11 budget and the deficit in the 2012-13 budget without providing further evidence or context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the surplus in the 2010-11 budget and the deficit in the 2012-13 budget are solely the result of the actions of the respective political parties, without considering other factors that could have contributed to the financial outcomes.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the surplus and deficit, such as the use of borrowing and one-time federal funds to balance the budget, which could have influenced the financial outcomes.
